abstract: Europe’s biggest bank put aside $3.2 billion for bad loans in the United States in the first quarter, in line with its expectations.
snippet: Europe’s biggest bank put aside $3.2 billion for bad loans in the United States in the first quarter, in line with its expectations.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  HSBC Holdings, Europe’s biggest bank, said on Monday that a recession in the United States was “increasingly likely” because the housing market would continue to deteriorate into next year.

headline.main: For HSBC, Asia Offsets Loan Problems in the U. S.
